definition.value: Brucella DeltaexsA mutant showed decreased survival in mice compared to the survival of parental strain S2308. This demonstrated that ExsA is critical for full bacterial virulence. The B. abortus exsA deletion mutant was used as a live vaccine candidate. Challenge experiments revealed that the exsA mutant strain induced superior protective immunity in BALB/c mice compared to the protective immunity induced by strain S19 or RB51
A mucR mutant has a significantly reduced degree of colonization in mice and protects against wild type B. melitensis 16M
A omp25 mutant is attenuated and provides protection against challenge in mice
A omp31 mutant in Brucella melitensis was attenuated and provided protection against challenge in mice
A pgk mutant is attenuated in mice and induces significant protection from challenge with wild type B. abortus
A pgm mutant is attenuated in mice and induces significant protection from challenge with wild type B. abortus
A purE/purK mutant of B. melitensis 16M was attenuated in mice when given intraperitoneally. Nine weeks after immunization, mice were protected from challenge with wild type B. melitensis

Mice infected with delta purE201 developed only five to eight times normal spleen weight at 1 week p.i. and produced no interleukin-6 in their serum, which is much lower than the mice infected with the parental strain (16M)
A vaccine that prevents or treats arthritis.

label.value: live attenuated B. abortus with deletion of znuA

definition.value: Deletion of gene znuA attenuates Brucella abortus and this live attenuated vaccine was challenged in mice. These mice showed significantly fewer spenic CFU

label.value: Burkholderia pseudomallei aroC deletion mutant vaccine

definition.value: The aroC deletion in the resultant mutant, designated A2 Delta aroC, was confirmed by PCR, Southern hybridization and failure of the mutant to grow in a defined medium without aromatic compounds. The constructed unmarked aroC mutant of B. pseudomallei is attenuated in both BALB/c and C57Bl/6 mice and is able to confer significant protection in C57Bl/6 mice.
An asd mutant is highly attenuated in mice. This mutant was also able to protect against acute inhalation melioidosis caused by challenge with wild type B. pseudomallei
Mice that were challenged with a higher dose of mutant 56:65 purM were protected
Although 30:93a purN -immunized mice were challenged with a 10-fold higher dose of WT E8, mice were strongly protected and showed no signs of clinical illness until the experiment was terminated

A crp mutant is attenuated in zebrafish and catfish that were immunized intramuscularly and intracoelomically, respectively. Six weeks after immunization, both zebrafish and catfish were protected from challenge with wild type E. ictaluri
An aroC mutant is attenuated in zebra fish. The aroC mutant is also protective against challenge with wild type E. tarda and has a relative percent survival of 68.3%
An aroC and slyA mutant is attenuated in zebra fish. This mutant is also protective against challenge from wild type E. tarda, resulting in a relative percent survival of 80.1%
An aroC mutant is attenuated in zebra fish. The aroC mutant is also protective against challenge with wild type E. tarda and has a relative percent survival of 68.3%
An aroC and esrC mutant is attenuated in zebra fish. This mutant is also protective against challenge with wild type E. tarda and has a relative percent survival of 71.3%
An aroC mutant is attenuated in zebra fish. The aroC mutant is also protective against challenge with wild type E. tarda and has a relative percent survival of 68.3%
An esrB mutant is highly attenuated in fish (turbot), with an LD50 of 10(8.1)cfu/fish. Vaccination with this mutant elicited significant protection from wild type E. tarda
A carAB mutant is attenuated in turkeys and induces significant protection from challenge with wild type E. coli
A vaccine that prevents or treats an autoimmune disease.

A ler deletion mutant derived from wild-type EHEC O157:H7 86-24 was constructed by use of suicide vector pCVD442. Following challenge of 7-day-old suckling mice with O157:H7 EDL933, 75.2% born to group B mothers (immunized with F25) sur- vived, as did 83.0% born to group C mothers (immunized with F105). The surviving suckling mice consistently gained body weight. Only 16.8% of sucking mice born to control group mice survived the challenge

Deletion of waaL results in a strain that stimulates enhanced urothelial cytokine secretion, which is an enhanced innate immune response. Inoculation with the vaccine strain protected mice against challenge with a broad range of clinical uropathogenic E. coli isolates and produced immunity that lasted >= 8 weeks.

There was a deletion in gene capB of F. tularensis live vaccine strain. LVS capB, while much less virulent than LVS, induces potent protective immunity against lethal LVS i.n. challenge in mice, comparable to that induced by LVS
A clpB mutant in Francisella tularensis subspecies tularensis strain SCHU S4 was attenuated and provided protection against aerosol challenge in mice
A FTL0552 mutant in Francisella tularensis was attenuated and provided partial protection in mice against challenge with a lethal dose of the virulent SchuS4 strain when compared to naive mice
An FTT0918 mutant showed significantly reduced virulence in mice. Mice that recovered from infection with the mutant were protected 2 months later from challenge with wild type F. tularensis

A galU mutant is attenuated in mice, with only transient weight loss observed. Two months after inoculation, mice were challenge with wild type F. tularensis and were protected, once again only experiencing transient weight loss
A guaA mutant is highly attenuated in mice and induces significant protection from challenge with parent strain F. tularensis LVS
A guaB mutant is attenuated in mice and induces significant protection from challenge with parent strain F. tularensis LVS

Intranasal vaccination with KKF235 (F. tularensis subsp. novicida mutant (DeltaiglB) ) protected mice from subsequent homotypic challenge with U112 as well as heterotypic challenge with F. tularensis subsp. holarctica (LVS). Most significantly, oral immunization with KKF235 protected mice from a highly lethal subsp. tularensis (SCHU S4) pulmonary challenge
A purMCD mutant in Francisela tularensis was attenuated. A low dosage of F. tularensis LVS delta purMCD mutant provided protection against challenge in mice
A purMCD mutant in Francisella tularensis was attenuated. A low dose of the F. tularensis LVS delta purMCD mutant provided protection against subsequent lethal challenge with the LVS parental strain
Mice, which had been immunized with at least 6.95x103 cfu of F. tularensis U112 purF::Cm, were protected against the subsequent F. tularensis subspecies novicida challenge.
A Streptococcus  vaccine against Streptococcus pyogenes infection.

A sodC mutant in Francisella tularensis subspecies holarctica was attenuated and provided protection and cleared the infection against lethal challenge in nearly 50% of the mice infected with the deletion of sodC mutant.

A wbtA mutant in Francisella tularensis was attenuated and provided protection in mice against challenge with an otherwise lethal dose of either F. tularensis LVS or a fully virulent clinical isolate of F. tularensis type B

A wbtI mutant is attenuated in mice. The mutant protected against a low dose challenge with the parental strain, but was less effective against higher doses. However, increasing the immunization dose increased the resistance to higher challenge doses
An aroA mutant is highly attenuated in mice and induced significant protection after two doses from challenge with wild type M. haemolytica
An lpd mutant is highly attenuated in chickens and induces significant protection from challenge with wild type M. gallisepticum
A metH mutant, in combination with a siaD mutation, is attenuated in mice and induces significant protection from challenge with wild type N. meningitidis
A siaD mutant, in combination with either a metH or rfaF mutation, is attenuated in mice and induces protection from challenge with wild type N. meningitidis
A siaD mutant, in combination with either a metH or rfaF mutation, is attenuated in mice and induces protection from challenge with wild type N. meningitidis
An rfaF mutant, in combination with a siaD mutation, is attenuated in mice and induces significant protection from challenge with wild type N. meningitidis
An aroA mutant is highly attenuated in calves and induces significant protection from challenge with wild type P. multocida
An aroA mutant is attenuated in mice and induced significant protection from challenge with wild type S. typhi Ty2

Inactivation of AroC results in attenuation in humans, and the deletions of both AroC and AroD provide a high level of safety against restoration of pathogenicity by recombination. An aroC/aroD-deleted derivative of S. Typhi strain Ty2 (the parent strain of Ty21a) is designated the strain "CVD 908"

Inactivation of AroD results in attenuation in humans, and the deletions of both AroC and AroD provide a high level of safety against restoration of pathogenicity by recombination. An aroC/aroD-deleted derivative of S. Typhi strain Ty2 (the parent strain of Ty21a) is designated the strain "CVD 908"

Inactivation of AroC results in attenuation in humans, and the deletions of both AroC and AroD provide a high level of safety against restoration of pathogenicity by recombination. An aroC/aroD-deleted derivative of S. Typhi strain Ty2 (the parent strain of Ty21a) is designated the strain "CVD 908"
An asd mutant, alone or in combination with a rfc mutation, is attenuated in mice and induces significant protection from challenge with wild type Salmonella typhimurium
An asd mutant, alone or in combination with a rfc mutation, is attenuated in mice and induces significant protection from challenge with wild type Salmonella typhimurium
An rfc mutant, in combination with an asd mutation, is attenuated in mice and induces significant protection from challenge with wild type S. typhimurium
An atpA mutant is attenuated in mice and induces significant protection from challenge with wild type S. typhimurium

A cbiA mutant, in combination with a cobS mutation, is attenuated in chickens and induces significant protection from challenge with wild type S. Gallinarum. This mutant was also able to provide some protection against S. Enteritidis

A cobS mutant, in combination with a cbiA mutation, is attenuated in chickens and induces significant protection from challenge with wild type S. Gallinarum. This mutant was also able to provide some protection against S. Enteritidis

A guaBA and clpP mutant (CVD 1941) is attenuated in mice after oral immunization. This mutant is also protective in mice and had a vaccine efficacy of 76% against challenge with wild type Salmonella Enteritidis

A guaBA and clpP mutant (CVD 1941) is attenuated in mice after oral immunization. This mutant is also protective, and had a vaccine efficacy of 76% against challenge with wild type Salmonella Enteritidis

A mutation in clpP (CS2007) causes hyperflagellation. These hyperflagellated bacteria are attenuated in mice, and an LD50 for CS2007 could not be determined because mice did not die after inoculation with the highest dose. CS2007 also elicited protection in mice from challenge with wild type S. typhimurium
